intro: Olsynium douglasii var. douglasii, commonly known as the Douglas's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in well-drained soils in open, sunny habitats. It is part of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The species is often found in meadows and along rocky slopes, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
